abstract: Cowboys Coach Jason Garrett shouldn't shy away from consulting advanced statistics and using them in specific game situations.
snippet: Cowboys Coach Jason Garrett shouldn't shy away from consulting advanced statistics and using them in specific game situations.
lead_paragraph: Jason Garrett has received a lot of criticism for his decision to call three straight runs while up, 16-13, with 3 minutes 36 seconds to play in Sunday's game in New England, perhaps the harshest of which came from his boss. "We rolled the dice at the end and went conservative," the Cowboys' owner, Jerry Jones, said, "and it bit us. You always second-guess whether or not we should have tried to run a little offense down there instead of running it three times."

headline.main: Jerry Jones Was Right; Cowboys Should Have Passed
